User Story: As an archivist, I would like to package email exports for long term preservation.
As an archivist, I would like to download email from an IMAP account to preserve it.
As an archivist, I would like to easily create PDF access files for email.
As an archivist, I would like to preserve email, including externally-hosted content.
As an archivist, I would like to be able to easily install and use the Mailbag utility on my computer.
As an archivist, I would like to package email attachments for long-term preservation.
As an archivist, I would like to package email exports into BagIt compliant bags before. transferring those bags to my repository system so I can validate fixity during transfer.
As an archivist, I would like to deliver packaged emails via a network connection.
As an archivist, I would like to be able to validate the contents of a Mailbag package
As an archivist, I would like to easily view the folder structure and other organizational details about a set of emails.
As an archivist, I would like to easily view a list of senders and receivers for a set of emails.
As an archivist, I would like to preserve the web pages linked within emails.
As an archivist, I would like to process large email inboxes on my computer.
As a person with a vision impairment, I would like to be able to zoom and resize text and/or use a screen reader.
As an IT professional, I would like a command line tool to package email before transferring them to an archival repository.
As an IT professional, I would like a tool that is easy to upgrade and maintain.
As an IT professional, I would like to choose the dependencies that work best in my environment.
As a historian, I would like to be able to browse and view individual emails.
As a historian, I would like to be able to see basic information about a group of emails in a Mailbag.
As a historian, I would like to access attachments and web pages linked in emails.
As a data scientist, I would like to easily extract text and entities from email to analyze at scale.
As a tool maintainer, I would like a common and stable export format to save email.
As a self-archivist, I would like an email export format that allows easy viewing of individual emails.
As a self-archivist, I would like an email export tool that is well-documented and easy to use without command line experience.
